oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fannie Battle carol tea heralds Christmas season: another group of territorial chairmen observes Mrs. Howard Adkins as she displays the symbol of the carol singers, circa 1951 December 04
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Fannie Battle Day Home territorial chairmen seen at the home of Mrs. Howard Adkins, circa 4 December 1951, where she displays the symbol of the Fannie Battle carol singers, "A candle in the window; a carol at the door." Seen from left to right standing, are: Mrs. Howard Atkins, Mrs. C.C. Carlisle, Mrs. Benson Trimble, Mrs. C.C. McDowell and Mrs. Z.T. Osborne; seated, Mrs. Gene Stanley, Mrs. Thomas E. Watts, Mrs. John Donnelly, Mrs. J.P. White, Miss Frances White and Mrs. Randolph Sherling. This photograph illustrated the newspaper article "Fannie Battle Carol Tea Heralds Christmas Season," published in the 4 December 1951 issue of the Nashville Banner. Forms part of the Fannie Battle Day Home Records. 1 photograph : b & w ; 13.5 x 10.5 in.
